text:
Hmm I only had to do this once and I remember it was a very weird case. I ended up using an Nginx proxy that just did the forwarding - $5/month on Digital Ocean. Having seen <http://easyredir.com|easyredir.com> I’d probably use that.

<https://ns1.com/> could be worth a look for DNS, although probably a bit pricey.

<https://dnsimple.com/> - these guys do it… but for $25/month for https redirects…
